references.paper_title: Graph neural networks are dynamic programmers
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical foundation for using GNNs to solve combinatorial optimization problems, which is the core methodology used in this paper for task planning.

references.paper_title: Learning combinatorial optimization algorithms over graphs
references.reason: This paper introduces a method for learning combinatorial optimization algorithms using GNNs, which is directly relevant to the task planning problem addressed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Sparks of artificial general intelligence: Early experiments with gpt-4
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of the capabilities of large language models (LLMs), which are central to the task planning problem discussed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Taskbench: Benchmarking large language models for task automation
references.reason: This paper introduces the TaskBench benchmark, a dataset used to evaluate the performance of LLMs on task planning tasks, which is directly relevant to the empirical evaluation in this paper.

references.paper_title: HuggingGPT: Solving AI tasks with chatGPT and its friends in Hugging Face
references.reason: This paper introduces HuggingGPT, an LLM-based agent that utilizes a task planning module to solve complex AI tasks, serving as a key inspiration and related work to this paper.
